data.content: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second (186,282 miles per second). This speed is considered to be the ultimate speed limit of the universe according to the theory of relativity proposed by Albert Einstein.

The speed of light in water is slower than in a vacuum. Light travels at about 225,000 kilometers per second in water, which is approximately 25% slower than its speed in a vacuum. This difference in speed is due to the higher refractive index of water compared to that of a vacuum, which causes light to slow down when passing through a medium like water.
what's the distance from the sun and the earth?

The average distance from the Sun to the Earth is about 93 million miles (150 million kilometers). This distance is known as an astronomical unit (AU), which is often used as a unit of measurement for distances within our solar system. Keep in mind that this distance can vary slightly throughout the year due to the elliptical orbit of the Earth around the Sun.
You asked about the distance from the Sun to the Earth.
You asked about the speed of light in a vacuum and in water.
